headline: US-based ADM shuts down Brazil pet food plant
summary: SAO PAULO (Reuters) -U.S.-based grain merchant Archer Daniels Midland is closing a pet food plant in Brazil, according to a statement sent this week to Reuters in response to questions, as part of broader efforts to streamline costs and operations.  ADM said workers at the facility, which will operate for another 90 days, were informed of the decision on July 15, a Sao Paulo-based press officer said.

headline: Sodas Might Contain Real Sugar Again. It Could Shake Up 3 Industries.
summary: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Coca-Cola had agreed to sweeten its signature soda with cane sugar in the U.S.

raw.headline: Sodas Might Contain Real Sugar Again. It Could Shake Up 3 Industries.
raw.summary: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Coca-Cola had agreed to sweeten its signature soda with cane sugar in the U.S.

headline: Coke's shift to cane sugar would be expensive, hurt US farmers
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -A possible move by Coca-Cola , and other beverage and food industries, to use cane sugar instead of corn syrup as a sweetener would be difficult and expensive to implement, while mostly negative for farmers in the United States.  U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Coca-Cola had agreed to use cane sugar in its beverages in the country after his discussions with the maker of the top soda pop brand.  Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and activists from his Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) campaign have been pushing for changes in ingredients used by the food and beverage industry, claiming the proposed substitutes are healthier.

headline: ADM, Ingredion Stocks Fall After Trump Says Coke Will Ditch Corn Syrup
summary: President Trump said Coca-Cola (KO) will go back to using cane sugar in its namesake soda, following criticism of sweeteners such as high-fructose corn syrup by Trump’s health secretary. Shares of both Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) and Ingredion (INGR), which supply corn syrup, fell Thursday.

headline: Trump’s Coca Cola post tanked share prices for high fructose corn syrup makers
summary: Shares for Archer-Daniels-Midland and Ingredion both fell at least 6% in after hours trading.

headline: ADM, Ingredion Stocks Slip as Trump Says Coca-Cola Will Switch to Cane Sugar in the US
summary: President Trump said in a social media post that Coca-Cola officials agreed with his request for the soft drink maker to switch to using cane sugar to sweeten its eponymous soft drink in the U.S.

headline: Trump Says Coke Will Ditch Corn Syrup, Knocking ADM, Ingredion Stocks
summary: President Trump said Coca-Cola (KO) will go back to using cane sugar in its namesake soda, following criticism of sweeteners such as high-fructose corn syrup by Trump’s health secretary. Shares of both Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) and Ingredion (INGR), which supply corn syrup, fell Thursday morning.

headline: Coca-Cola says it appreciates Trump's 'enthusiasm' after president says company will use real sugar in drinks
summary: Coca-Cola looks set to be the latest company to make a significant ingredient changes as big food responds to shifting consumer tastes and lawmaker expectations.

headline: Archer-Daniels-Midland stock drops after Trump’s Coca-Cola sugar claim
summary: Investing.com -- Archer-Daniels-Midland (NYSE:ADM) stock dropped as much as 5.6% in premarket trading Thursday following President Trump’s announcement that Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) has agreed to use "real cane sugar" in its U.S. soda products.

headline: Trump & Coca-Cola, Novartis earnings, Netflix preview: Trending Tickers
summary: President Trump says Coca-Cola (KO) will switch to real cane sugar in US drinks, though the company has yet to confirm, pressuring corn futures and shares of companies that make corn syrup including ADM (ADM) and Ingredion (INGR). Novartis (NVS) reported a second quarter earnings beat and announced a $10 billion buyback. The company also revealed its CFO is retiring, and sales of a key drug disappointed. Netflix (NFLX) reports earnings after the bell, with strong revenue and profit growth expected as investors weigh high expectations and valuation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief: Market Sunrise here.
